category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
GOD, MY KING,

You are the creator and Father of everyone, because You made us all and You keep us going.
You are a special Father to those who know, love, and honor You—the ones who find that following You isn't a heavy burden, that Your work is something to be proud of, and that Your ways are good.

But I have to admit, Your incredible goodness hasn't changed me as much as it should have.
I haven't made the most of the spiritual opportunities You've given me.
I've been lazy and careless about doing good for others.
I'm coming to You now with all my mistakes and sins;
have mercy on me,
and let Your goodness be what makes me truly want to change.

Help me to hate and turn away from every wrong path,
to pay attention to my own character,
to control what I say,
to guard my heart with everything I've got,
to watch out for and pray against temptation,
to crush the sin in my life,
and to be genuinely concerned for the salvation of others.

O God, I can't stand the thought of my loved ones being lost.
Let the people I'm closest to
be precious in Your sight and dedicated to Your glory.

Bless my spiritual life at home and make it effective—
my prayers, my teaching, my self-discipline, and my example—
so that my house can be a place that prepares people for heaven,
and my church can be like Your garden,
filled with strong, faithful people that You planted there
for Your glory.

Please don't let the members of my family who are kind, moral, and likable
miss out on heaven in the end.
Grant that the hopeful signs I see—a sensitive conscience,
a soft heart, the times they're challenged or moved by Your Word—
won't just fade away.
Instead, let those sparks grow into a true and lasting faith for everyone I love.
